title: Authors and Citation
text: Staley J (2024). mvshape: mvshape. R package version 0.0.2, https://jrs95.github.io/mvshape/, https://github.com/jrs95/mvshape.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mvshape: mvshape},   author = {James Staley},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.2, https://jrs95.github.io/mvshape/},   url = {https://github.com/jrs95/mvshape}, }

title: mvshape
text: package used assess shape relationship exposure outcome using fractional polynomials multivariate meta-analysis.

title: mvshape
text: fracpoly: method fits best-fitting fractional polynomial degree 1 /2 association outcome exposure. mvshape: method performs multivariate meta-analysis associations outcome quantiles exposure across studies. fracploy_plot: function plots fractional polynomial model. mvshape_plot: function plots mvshape model. fracpoly_mvshape_plot: function plots fractional polynomial mvshape models.

title: mvshape
code: # Library library(mvshape)  # Data y <- rnorm(5000) x <- rnorm(5000, 10, 1) c1 <- rbinom(5000, 1, 0.5) c2 <- rnorm(5000) study <- as.factor(c(rep("study1", 1000), rep("study2", 1000), rep("study3", 1000), rep("study4", 1000), rep("study5", 1000))) covar <- data.frame(c1 = c1, c2 = c2, study = study)  # Analyses fp <- fracpoly(y = y, x = x, covar = covar, family = "gaussian") fracpoly_plot(fp) mvma <- mvshape(y = y, x = x, covar = covar[,c("c1", "c2")], study = study, family = "gaussian") mvshape_plot(mvma) fracpoly_mvshape_plot(fracpoly = fp, mvshape = mvma)

title: mvshape
text: Please cite R package using link: https://github.com/jrs95/mvshape

title: fracpoly — fracpoly
text: fracpoly fits best fitting fractional polynomial degree 1 2.

title: fracpoly — fracpoly
code: fracpoly(y = y, x = x, covar = NULL, family = "gaussian")

title: fracpoly — fracpoly
text: y outcome. x exposure. covar data.frame covariates. family glm family (options: gaussian binomial).

title: fracpoly — fracpoly
text: List best-fitting polynomials degrees 1 2 well associated statistics. power_d1 power best-fitting fractional polynomial degree 1 fp1 model best-fitting fractional polynomial degree 1 power_d2 powers best-fitting fractional polynomial degree 2 fp2 model best-fitting fractional polynomial degree 2 p_d1 p-value testing best-fitting fractional polynomial degree 1 linear model p_d2 p-value testing best-fitting fractional polynomial degree 2 best-fitting fractional polynomial degree 2 xmin miniumum value exposure xmax maximum value exposure family family used analysis

title: fracpoly — fracpoly
code: # Data y <- rnorm(5000) x <- rnorm(5000, 10, 1) c1 <- rbinom(5000, 1, 0.5) c2 <- rnorm(5000) study <- c(rep("study1", 1000), rep("study2", 1000), rep("study3", 1000), rep("study4", 1000), rep("study5", 1000)) covar <- data.frame(c1 = c1, c2 = c2, study = study)  # Analyses res <- fracpoly(y = y, x = x, covar = covar, family = "gaussian")

title: fracpoly_mvshape_plot — fracpoly_mvshape_plot
text: fracpoly_mvshape_plot overlays fractional polynomial plot mvshape plot.

title: fracpoly_mvshape_plot — fracpoly_mvshape_plot
code: fracpoly_mvshape_plot(   fracpoly,   degree = "both",   mvshape,   xref = NULL,   logx = FALSE,   logy = FALSE,   pref_x = "x",   pref_y = "y",   xbreaks = NULL,   ybreaks = NULL,   cicolour = "grey",   betacolour = "black",   intcolour = "grey",   mvbetacolour = "red",   mvcicolour = "red",   xlim = NULL,   ylim = NULL )

title: fracpoly_mvshape_plot — fracpoly_mvshape_plot
text: fracpoly fracpoly object. degree fractonal polyniomal degree plotted (options: 1, 2 ). mvshape mvshape object. xref reference point figures binary outcomes. logx plot x-axis log-scale. logy plot y-axis log-scale. pref_x prefix x-axis. pref_y prefix y-axis. xbreaks breaks x-axis. ybreaks breaks y-axis. cicolour colour 95% confidence intervals. betacolour colour regression line. intcolour colour intercept line. xlim x-axis limits.

title: fracpoly_mvshape_plot — fracpoly_mvshape_plot
code: if (FALSE) { # Data y <- rnorm(5000) x <- rnorm(5000, 10, 1) c1 <- rbinom(5000, 1, 0.5) c2 <- rnorm(5000) study <- c(rep("study1", 1000), rep("study2", 1000), rep("study3", 1000), rep("study4", 1000), rep("study5", 1000)) covar <- data.frame(c1 = c1, c2 = c2, study = study)  # Analyses fp <- fracpoly(y = y, x = x, covar = covar, family = "gaussian") mvma <- mvshape(y = y, x = x, covar = covar[, c("c1", "c2")], study = study, family = "gaussian") fracpoly_mvshape_plot(fracpoly = fp, mvshape = mvma) }

title: fracpoly_plot — fracpoly_plot
text: fracpoly_plot plots best fitting fractional polynomial.

title: fracpoly_plot — fracpoly_plot
code: fracpoly_plot(   fracpoly,   degree = "both",   xref = NULL,   logx = FALSE,   logy = FALSE,   pref_x = "x",   pref_y = "y",   xbreaks = NULL,   ybreaks = NULL,   cicolour = "grey",   betacolour = "black",   intcolour = "grey",   xlim = NULL )

title: fracpoly_plot — fracpoly_plot
text: fracpoly fracpoly object. degree fractonal polyniomal degree plotted (options: 1, 2 ). xref reference point figures binary outcomes. logx plot x-axis log-scale. logy plot y-axis log-scale. pref_x prefix x-axis. pref_y prefix y-axis. xbreaks breaks x-axis. ybreaks breaks y-axis. cicolour colour 95% confidence intervals. betacolour colour regression line. intcolour colour intercept line. xlim x-axis limits.

title: fracpoly_plot — fracpoly_plot
code: # Data y <- rnorm(5000) x <- rnorm(5000, 10, 1) c1 <- rbinom(5000, 1, 0.5) c2 <- rnorm(5000) study <- c(rep("study1", 1000), rep("study2", 1000), rep("study3", 1000), rep("study4", 1000), rep("study5", 1000)) covar <- data.frame(c1 = c1, c2 = c2, study = study)  # Analyses res <- fracpoly(y = y, x = x, covar = covar, family = "gaussian") fracpoly_plot(res)

title: mvshape — mvshape
text: mvshape fits multivariate meta-analysis groups exposure (e.g. deciles).

title: mvshape — mvshape
code: mvshape(   y = y,   x = x,   covar = NULL,   study = NULL,   ngrp = 10,   refgrp = 1,   family = "gaussian",   float = FALSE,   method = "reml" )

title: mvshape — mvshape
text: y outcome. x exposure. covar data.frame covariates. study study variable. ngrp number quantiles exposure. refgrp reference group. family glm family (options: gaussian binomial). float floating point variances. method meta-analysis method.

title: mvshape — mvshape
text: List multivariate meta-analysis results group. results data.frame results: q quantile group, xbeta mean x quantile, xse standard error mean x quantile, beta regression coefficient association y quantile x, se standard error regression coefficient association y quantile x varcor variance-covariance matrix xmin miniumum value exposure xmax maximum value exposure family family used analysis

title: mvshape — mvshape
code: # Data y <- rnorm(5000) x <- rnorm(5000, 10, 1) c1 <- rbinom(5000, 1, 0.5) c2 <- rnorm(5000) study <- c(rep("study1", 1000), rep("study2", 1000), rep("study3", 1000), rep("study4", 1000), rep("study5", 1000)) covar <- data.frame(c1 = c1, c2 = c2, study = study)  # Analyses res <- mvshape(y = y, x = x, covar = covar[, c("c1", "c2")], study = study, family = "gaussian")

text: mvshape_plot plots meta-analysis results mean values exposure group.
